src:
Bertemu PM Australia di KTT ASEAN, Presiden Jokowi Bahas Papua
05 Nov 2019, 09:03 by ABC
Presiden Indonesia Joko Widodo bertemu dengan Perdana Menteri (PM) Australia, Scott Morrison, di sela-sela Konferensi Tingkat Tinggi (KTT) ASEAN di Bangkok (4/11/2019). Dalam pertemuan mereka, Presiden Jokowi menceritakan kunjungannya ke Papua dan berjanji segera meratifikasi kemitraan komperehensif IA-CEPA.
Bertempat di Impact Exhibition and Convention Center, Bangkok, Thailand, Presiden Jokowi menceritakan kunjungannya ke Papua akhir Oktober lalu kepada Perdana Menteri Scott Morrison.
Dalam pertemuan itu, mantan Gubernur DKI Jakarta ini menuturkan bahwa ia telah meresmikan Jembatan Youtefa yang menghubungkan Jayapura dengan Distrik Muara Tami.
"Papua adalah provinsi pertama yang saya kunjungi setelah saya dilantik. Alhamdullilah saat ini situasi Papua dan Papua Barat telah kembali normal. Aktivitas ekonomi telah berjalan kembali," papar Presiden Indonesia ini kepada Morrison seperti tertulis dalam keterangan resminya (4/11/2019).
"Saya juga resmikan Pusat Pengembangan start-up Pemuda Papua, Papuan Youth Creative Hub. Dua hal tersebut merupakan manisfestasi komitmen saya untuk membangun Papua," imbuh Presiden Jokowi.
PM Morrison lantas memuji langkah Presiden Indonesia itu.
"Kunjungan Papua dan komitmen Presiden Jokowi untuk membangun Papua sangat bermanfaat."
"Terima kasih telah berbagi hasil kunjungan ke Papua," sebut PM Morrison dalam siaran pers yang diterima ABC.
Di sisi lain, persoalan Papua di Australia menjadi semakin kompleks setelah aktivis hak asasi manusia (HAM) asal Indonesia yang kini berada di Australia, Veronica Koman, menemui beberapa anggota Parlemen Australia, termasuk politisi Partai Liberal -partai asal Scott Morrison, pertengahan Oktober lalu.
Veronica, yang kerapkali mengecam berbagai kebijakan pemerintahan Joko Widodo di Papua, khususnya Papua Barat, dianggap berbagai pihak menggalang dukungan untuk advokasi yang dilakukannya.
"Saya harapannya supaya Australia sebagai negara terbesar di Pasifik dan salah satu tetangga terdekat bisa bantu menghentikan pertumpahan darah di West Papua (Papua Barat)," kata Veronica kepada ABC kala itu.
Perempuan ini juga mendapat penghargaan Sir Ronald Wilson yang diberikan lembaga non-pemerintah, Australian Council for International Development (ACFID).
Ia menerima penghargaan itu di Sydney (23/10/2019) karena dianggap berani menyuarakan pelanggaran HAM di Papua dan Papua Barat.


Delegasi Indonesia dan Australia bertemu di sela-sela KTT ASEAN di Bangkok (4/11/2019). Biro Pers Sekretariat Presiden

Segera ratifikasi IA-CEPA
Selain membahas Papua, pertemuan dua kepala negara itu juga mengangkat soal kemitraan komprehensif IA-CEPA (Indonesia Australia Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement).
Kemitraan komprehensif IA-CEPA adalah kesepakatan kedua negara di bidang perdagangan barang, jasa, investasi, serta kerja sama ekonomi.
Presiden Jokowi menyambut baik proses ratifikasi IA-CEPA di Parlemen Australia.
Oleh karena itu, Presiden Jokowi kembali menegaskan komitmen Pemerintahannya untuk memperkuat kemitraan strategis komprehensif dengan Australia.
"Proses ratifikasi IA-CEPA di Indonesia akan dilakukan segera," kata Presiden Jokowi dalam keterangan resmi itu.
Menanggapi pernyataan Presiden Jokowi tersebut, PM Morrison menyambut baik komitmen Indonesia.
"Saya berharap akhir tahun ini bisa selesai karena saya melihat sudah tidak ada lagi perbedaan pandangan," sebut PM Morrison dalam keterangan resminya.
Melalui IA-CEPA, seluruh produk ekspor Indonesia bisa masuk ke pasar Australia tanpa bea masuk, dan 99 persen produk ekspor Australia bisa masuk ke Indonesia tanpa bea masuk.
Selain itu, Australia menyediakan kuota sebanyak 4.100 working holiday visa (WHV) dengan kenaikan 5 persen per tahun sampai mencapai 5.000 orang per tahun.
Kemitraan baru
KTT ASEAN ke-35 di Bangkok juga dihadiri 15 pemimpin negara Asia-Pasifik yang sepakat untuk melakukan perdagangan bebas, yang disebut-sebut terbesar di dunia.
Kemitraan komprehensif kawasan (RCEP), nama perjanjian kawasan itu, adalah kesepakatan antara 10 negara anggota ASEAN dengan Jepang, China, Korea Selatan, Selandia Baru, Australia, dan India.
Namun belakangan, India menolak untuk bergabung dalam kesepakatan ini.
Australia sendiri telah memiliki kesepakatan dagang bilateral dengan masing-masing negara anggota ASEAN dan dengan beberapa negara lain dalam perjanjian itu.
Namun pakta kesepakatan baru ini membakukan aturan dagang di 15 negara dan memberi akses yang lebih baik kepada pasar, di luar dari apa yang tertuang dalam perjanjian biasa.

Simak berita-berita menarik lainnya di situs ABC Indonesia.
text:
Meeting the Australian PM at the ASEAN Summit, President Jokowi Discusses Papua
05 Nov 2019, 09:03 by ABC
Indonesian President Joko Widodo met with Prime Minister (PM) of Australia, Scott Morrison, on the sidelines of the ASEAN Summit (Summit) in Bangkok (4/11/2019). During their meeting, President Jokowi recounted his visit to Papua and promised to immediately ratify the comprehensive IA-CEPA partnership.
Located at the Impact Exhibition and Convention Center, Bangkok, Thailand, President Jokowi told his visit to Papua at the end of October to Prime Minister Scott Morrison.
During the meeting, the former Governor of DKI Jakarta said that he had inaugurated the Youtefa Bridge connecting Jayapura with the Muara Tami District.
"Papua is the first province that I visited after I was appointed. Thank God, the current situation in Papua and West Papua has returned to normal. Economic activity has been running again," said the Indonesian President to Morrison as written in his official statement (4/11/2019).
"I also inaugurated the Papua Youth Start-up Development Center, Papuan Youth Creative Hub. These two things are manifestation of my commitment to develop Papua," added President Jokowi.
PM Morrison then praised the Indonesian President's steps.
"Papua's visit and President Jokowi's commitment to develop Papua are very beneficial."
"Thank you for sharing the results of your visit to Papua," Prime Minister Morrison said in a press release received by ABC.
On the other hand, the problem of Papua in Australia has become even more complex after Indonesian human rights activist Veronica Koman met several members of the Australian Parliament, including Liberal Party politician from Scott Morrison, in mid-October.
Veronica, who often condemns the various policies of Joko Widodo's administration in Papua, especially West Papua, is considered by various parties to garner support for his advocacy.
"I hope that Australia as the largest country in the Pacific and one of the closest neighbors can help stop the bloodshed in West Papua (West Papua)," Veronica told ABC at the time.
This woman also received the Sir Ronald Wilson award given by a non-governmental organization, the Australian Council for International Development (ACFID).
He received the award in Sydney (10/23/2019) because he was considered brave to voice human rights violations in Papua and West Papua.


The Indonesian and Australian delegations met on the sidelines of the ASEAN Summit in Bangkok (4/11/2019). Presidential Secretariat Press Bureau

Immediate ratification of IA-CEPA
In addition to discussing Papua, the meeting of the two heads of state also raised the issue of a comprehensive IA-CEPA (Indonesia Australia Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement).
The IA-CEPA comprehensive partnership is an agreement between the two countries in the fields of trade in goods, services, investment and economic cooperation.
President Jokowi welcomed the IA-CEPA ratification process in the Australian Parliament.
Therefore, President Jokowi reiterated his Government's commitment to strengthen a comprehensive strategic partnership with Australia.
"The IA-CEPA ratification process in Indonesia will be carried out soon," President Jokowi said in the official statement.
Responding to President Jokowi's statement, PM Morrison welcomed Indonesia's commitment.
"I hope that the end of this year can be finished because I see that there are no more differences of opinion," Prime Minister Morrison said in his official statement.
Through the IA-CEPA, all Indonesian export products can enter the Australian market without import duties, and 99 percent of Australian export products can enter Indonesia without import duties.
In addition, Australia provides a quota of 4,100 working holiday visas (WHV) with an increase of 5 percent per year to reach 5,000 people per year.
New partnership
The 35th ASEAN Summit in Bangkok was also attended by 15 leaders of Asia-Pacific countries who agreed to conduct free trade, which is said to be the largest in the world.
Regional comprehensive partnership (RCEP), the name of the regional agreement, is an agreement between the 10 ASEAN member countries with Japan, China, South Korea, New Zealand, Australia and India.
But lately, India refused to join this agreement.
Australia itself has bilateral trade agreements with each ASEAN member country and with several other countries in the agreement.
But the new treaty pact standardizes trade rules in 15 countries and gives better access to markets, apart from what is stated in the usual agreements.

Check out other interesting news on the ABC Indonesia website.
